genres.name: Fiction
genres.description: Literature created from the imagination, not presented as fact.

genres.name: Dystopian
genres.description: A genre of speculative fiction that explores social and political structures in a dark, nightmare world.

genres.name: Romance
genres.description: A genre centered on romantic love between two people and usually has an emotionally satisfying and optimistic ending.

genres.name: Adventure
genres.description: A genre of fiction that usually presents danger, or gives the reader a sense of excitement.

genres.name: Post-apocalyptic
genres.description: A genre of fiction set in a world or civilization after a catastrophic disaster.

genres.name: Fantasy
genres.description: A genre of speculative fiction set in a fictional universe, often inspired by real world myth and folklore.

genres.name: Thriller
genres.description: A genre that uses suspense, tension, and excitement as its main elements.

genres.name: Mystery
genres.description: A genre that involves solving a crime or uncovering secrets.
